title: Project for the rehabilitation of Minneriya, Giritale, Galoya, Huruluwewa and Rajanganaya Irrigation Systems
decision_details: - Due to the severe damage caused by the recent floods to several major irrigation schemes in the dry zone, severe obstacles have arisen in the release of water to the agricultural lands in those schemes. Provisions amounting to Rs 2,000 million have been allocated through the Budget proposals 2025 for the rehabilitation of the canal systems of the Galoya Scheme in the Ampara District, the Minneriya and Giritale Irrigation schemes in the Polonnaruwa District and the Huruluwewa and Rajanganaya Irrigation schemes in the Anuradhapura District, which are operating under the Department of Irrigation. The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation to carry out the following rehabilitation works in the above-mentioned irrigation projects utilizing the said provisions:* Repairing the Irrigation System and Drainage Canals of the Minneriya Irrigation Scheme - Rs.300 million.* Repairing the Irrigation System of the Giritale Irrigation Scheme - Rs.200 million.* Repairing the Flood damaged and broken Canal Systems of the Galoya Project - Rs.900 million.* Repairing the Irrigation System and Drainage Canals of the Huruluwewa Irrigation Scheme - Rs.300 million.* Repairing Gravity and Lift Irrigation Systems of the Rajanganaya Irrigation Scheme - Rs.300 million.
